content.webTitle: The week's highlights: from November 13 to November 19

fields.headline: The week's highlights: from November 13 to November 19
fields.bodyText: TV Trainers, Reggae & The Olympics Soundclash between sportswear and reggae. Doc following Puma's go at organising a gig to celebrate the Jamaican olympic team. But will the acts offend? Monday 11pm, C4 TV MacIntyre's Big Sting Journalist MacIntyre lures a motley crew of cutpurses, chavs and ne'er-do-wells into the arms of the law. His method? A spoof TV show, and the promise of fame. Tuesday, 8pm, Five TV BBC Children In Need Wogan, tittering, at the helm for this celebration of 25 charitable years. Girls Aloud, soap stars, Blankety Blank and customary displays of plucky celebrity larking all promised. Friday, 7pm, BBC1 TV North And South Autumn season? Fetch the heavy novels! Simmering passion, headstrong women and taciturn men with sideburns in this adaptation of Elizabeth Gaskell's novel of industrial Britain. Sunday, 9pm, BBC1 TV Edge Of Life Extremely tricky medical dilemmas explored in this three-part series. Who should get the liver transplant? The recovering alcoholic? The man who tried suicide? Or the child? Thursday, 9pm, BBC2 Cable & satellite Chicago High-kicking stuff from Zeta-Jones and the scene- stealing RenËe Zellweger in this film version of the musical. Even Richard Gere comes across pretty well. Sunday, 8pm, Sky Movies 1 Cable & satellite Spellbound Documentary following kids (not forgetting their obsessive parents) as they compete in the USA's National Spelling Bee. Saturday, 8pm, FilmFour Weekly Cable & satellite Angry Britain Fuming Brits go hopping mad for, it would appear, almost no reason at all in this documentary. Angry husbands, goalkeepers and many more furies besides. Monday, 10pm, Sky One Cable & satellite True Horror With Anthony Head A hammy house of horrors. The Buffy man at the helm for this exploration of scary (but, wooo, real) phenomena Wednesday, 10pm, Discovery
